Package hippodrome

Class BettingCentre

  • java.lang.Object
    • hippodrome.BettingCentre

  • public class BettingCentre
extends java.lang.Object
    Place where the Spectators place their bets on the winning horse. As they come here to place their bets, they also come here to collect his (or hers) further gains, if such a scenario applies on a given race.
    Since:
    0.1
    Version:
    0.2
    Author:
    Hugo Fragata, Rui Lopes

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private int amountPerWinner
      Internal attribute of the Betting Centre which must contain the amount of money which should be given per winner, on a bet.
      private Bet[] bets
      Internal structure of bets.
      private java.util.Queue<Spectator> bettingQueue
      The waiting queue to contact the Broker on its tasks.
      private int moneyOnSafe
      Internal attribute of the Betting Centre which represents the amount of money which we have on our account, to perform the bets from the Spectator's.
      private int numberOfHorses
      Internal knowledge of the number of horses which are competing on track.
      private int numberOfSpectators
      Internal knowledge of the number of spectators which are attendind and betting on the races.
      private int[] winners
      Array of Spectator's identification numbers to whom the betting money should go.

    • Field Detail

      • bettingQueue

        private java.util.Queue<Spectator> bettingQueue
        The waiting queue to contact the Broker on its tasks. This could be used while waiting to a Spectator place a bet, or while wainting to a Spectator go collect his (or hers) gains. This structure is granted by a LinkedBlockingQueue Java class, which performs a blocking queue under the logic of a linked list.

      • bets

        private Bet[] bets
        Internal structure of bets. This is an array of bets (issued by an entity called Bet). Here, each index is related to a specific Spectator with its identification number. This is applicable since we consider that the Spectators have sequential numbers.

      • winners

        private int[] winners
        Array of Spectator's identification numbers to whom the betting money should go. Its length represents the number of winners and its content is the set of Spectator's IDs of who won the bet.

      • numberOfHorses

        private int numberOfHorses
        Internal knowledge of the number of horses which are competing on track.

      • numberOfSpectators

        private int numberOfSpectators
        Internal knowledge of the number of spectators which are attendind and betting on the races.

      • moneyOnSafe

        private int moneyOnSafe
        Internal attribute of the Betting Centre which represents the amount of money which we have on our account, to perform the bets from the Spectator's.

      • amountPerWinner

        private int amountPerWinner
        Internal attribute of the Betting Centre which must contain the amount of money which should be given per winner, on a bet.

        public BettingCentre​(int numberOfHorses,
                     int numberOfSpectators)

    • Method Detail

      • acceptTheBets

        public void acceptTheBets​()
        Accept all the bets done by the Spectators.

      • honourTheBets

        public void honourTheBets​()
        Give all the money to the respective betting parts - the Spectators.

      • placeABet

        public int placeABet​(int spectator,
                     int bet,
                     int horse)
        Let a Spectator place a bet onto the BettingCentre. This bet, made by a specific spectator is done respecting a proper horse, which represents a pair Horse/Jockey.
        Parameters:
        spectator - an identification of a Spectator which represents a better.
        bet - an amount of money represented as an integer, which the spectator wants to bet.
        horse - the identification of the pair Horse/Jockey in which the spectator wants to bet.
        Returns:
        the amount of money which was accepted by the Broker to place the bet.

      • goCollectTheGains

        public int goCollectTheGains​(int spectator)
        Let a spectator collect all his (or hers) gains after being placed a bet and a race had ended.
        Parameters:
        spectator - the Spectator which had collected some money after his (or hers) bet.
        Returns:
        the amount of money collected by the spectator.

      • areThereAnyWinners

        public boolean areThereAnyWinners​()
        Verification of bet's winners.
        Returns:
        true if anybody had won indeed; otherwise it will return false.
